column4: I just read an article saying that lighttpd is better in terms of performance and speed than apache2.. So my question is.. is lighthttpd supported by ubuntu?
are you serving something like digg then ?
but yes, its supported as in there are packages for it
thanks... amenado, can't get your point
its a universe package i think. do you really think you need lighttpd over apache ?
mmm... just so curious about this issue.. what do you think?

unless you are specifically having problems I would use apache. if you are having problems, then you'll need to be doing more than just looking at the webserver - for most people the overheads are in the applicatiosn they host on the server, not the server itself
you wont be able to measure it on a small site, and its hard to measure it on most typically larger sites too in my experience
experience is a best teacher.. have you tried both in different environment.. right? small site and larger ones?
if your cpu is sat 99% idle there is not much point in making life hard for yourself. we use lighttpd internally at work on one of our servers for serving up images, everything else is apache
those are small-medium sites (10,000+ hits per day)
but hosting webapps as opposed to just simple news pages - some of them serve web mapping to things like nasa worldwind
what are you hosting? just something for your own use on a lan ?
I wouldn't waste your time with lighttpd - by all means try it out for your own experience
most people run apache, and thats what you'll find the most guides for. if something needs lighttpd you can run that too
now.. can these two run on the same box simultaneously?
